3.8. Hardy inequality with capacitary distance to ∂Ω
Let Ω be a domain in Rⁿ, n > 2. As is well-known, the Hardy inequality
∫_Ω (|u(x)|/d(x))² dx ≤ c ∫_Ω |∇u|² dx, (3.9)
where u ∈ C_0^∞(Ω) and d(x) is the distance from x to ∂Ω, does not hold for any domain and conditions for its validity are known (see [69, p. 733–735] for references).
Problem. Prove that (3.9) holds for any domain Ω if d(x) is replaced by the capacitary distance defined by

d_α(x) = inf { r > 0 : cap(B_r(x) \ Ω) ≥ α cap(B_r) },

where α is a positive parameter and cap denotes the Wiener capacity defined in the previous subsection.
